Dear Mr. Robinson:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
9/24/19. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and
ISEP requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that
violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and your contract. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEPcitation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee Records
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the
following information prior to employment or at the time
specified in this rule: (e) Three dated references which are
obtained prior to employment from persons unrelated to
the employee and which are less than 12 months old.
One of fourteen employee files did not meet this requirement. The employee file held
three reference forms: two were completed, one was blank.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance with all additional ISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional MDHHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
CI 17-096 Treatment Plan Signatures
Treatment plans with a report date of August 1, 2017, or later
must have signatures from all appropriate case members within
30 days of the report date.
1

Three of three case files did not meet this requirement.
File one: The June 2019 treatment plan was signed by all participants. However, the
relative’s signature was not obtained until September 2019.
File two: Two treatment plans did not have the mother’s signature.
File three: Two treatment plans did not have parental signatures.
Although this requirement was not met, it is noted that efforts were made by the
facility. The facility documented that treatment plans were mailed to
parents/guardians upon completion. However, there was difficulty in obtaining
signatures within the required timeframe due to incarcerated and non-visiting
parents.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The facility has submitted three acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
2019C0212010- On 11/29/18 a Special Investigation was initiated due to an
allegation that staff used improper restraint with a resident. At the conclusion of the
evaluation the agency was found to be in violation of rules 157 and 159 regarding
behavior management and restraint. In addition, a violation was found due to a
reported medication error during this time frame. A CAP was approved on 1/31/19.
After CAP implementation an additional incident of improper restraint occurred
(2019C0212028). This incident involved a different staff person. The CAP was
adjusted and approved in August 2019.
2019C0212017- On 1/2/19 a Special Investigation was initiated due to an allegation
of insufficient supervision. At the conclusion of the evaluation the agency was found
to be in violation of rule 127, as bed checks were not completed as required during
sleeping hours. A CAP was approved on 1/31/19.There have been no further
violations.
2019C0212028- On 4/29/19 a Special Investigation was initiated due to an allegation
that a resident received red marks on his shoulder during a restraint. The agency
was found to be in violation of rule 159 as staff did not follow protocol regarding
restraints. A CAP was approved on 8/27/19. Due to the CAP implementation
2

occurring less than a month ago, compliance can not be determined at this time.
However, compliance monitoring will be ongoing.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules, ISEP requirements, and contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on their
regular license.
